717460f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street
717460f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from, but not including, 40th
Street. I1 the centre, on the S.E. corner of 41st Street, the
Hotel Continental may be seen, two years before its destruction.
May 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717454f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street
717454f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of 40th Street, seen
from the roof of the Metropolitan Opera House.
February 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from the street level. The Empire Theatre is the
building adjoining the corner.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717461f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street
717461f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from, but not including, 4Oth Street, to
and including 42nd Street. In the centre, may be seen the Hotel
Continental, on which demolition work has just begun.
February 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717454f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street
717454f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of 40th Street, seen
from the roof of the Metropolitan Opera House.
February 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from the street level. The Empire Theatre is the
building adjoining the corner.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717464f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street (West)
717464f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from, but not including West 40th Street,
showing the Broadway Theatre, at the S.W. corner of West 41st Street.
About 1902.
New york Edison Co.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717456f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street (West)
717456f-a.text:
1422-1432 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of
West 40th Street. The view shows the Empire Theatre, adjoining the S.E.
corner, with Browne's Chop House on the south.
About 1905.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
N.g ~ 2949

717459f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street (West)
717459f.text:
1432, 1426 and 1424 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.E.
corner of West 40th Street (left), showing the Empire Theatre at No.
1426 and Browne's Chop House at No. 1424. This is a negative copy of
a photograph.
About 1918.
Gift of Gilbert Miller.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

717458f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 40th Street (West)
717458f-a.text:
1432, 1426 and 1424 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.E.
corner of West 40th Street, showing the Empire Theatre at No. 1426.
This enterprise opened January 25, 1893. Adjacent to same is Browne's
Chop House, a similar famous spot in this former theatrical district.
On the left appears an extensive view eastward on the south side of
40th Street and upon which, at the rear of the Theatre is the 25-storied
Worlds Tower Building.
About 1918.
Gift of dilbert Miller.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
